description: Gion Kenji is short and perpetually pissed off about it. Iwashimizu Sumiaki is tall but timid. Although it's bullies that bring this unlikely pair together on the first day of high school, it's the rugby club that will make them friends.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Rugby
tags.description: Centers around the sport of rugby.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

Sukima Switch (スキマスイッチ?) is a Japanese jazz fusion duo consisting of core members Takuya Ōhashi (大橋卓弥 Ōhashi Takuya?), born May 9, 1978, and Shintarō Tokita (常田真太郎 Tokita Shintarō?), born February 25, 1978, formed in 2003. Formerly with BMG Japan (bought by SMEJ in early 2009), they signed with Sony Music Japan's Ariola Japan label in September 2009.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/p1b9f44vegyae8n)

Affiliated with [Dangun Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6521/). Initially worked as a production assistant.

His work on the 34th episode of [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/) attracted a lot of attention within the industry, as well as his more recent work in [Sword Art Online: Alicization](https://anilist.co/anime/100182/), in which he mostly teamed-up with [Kentarou Waki](https://anilist.co/staff/146156/).
**Hiroyuki Aoi** is a Japanese producer and publicity manager.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

**[Website](http://iris-in.com/)**

**Birthplace:** Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan

**Irie Shingo** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.
